title: If you had to play one champion for the entirety of your League life, which will it be?
body:
So, if you could only play one champion forever and be stuck with it, which would it be? For me, it would have to be {{champion:245}}. He was the first champion I bought on my other account, my first login screen, I love the theme, the voice acting, reminds me of Kingdom Hearts (would love a keyblade skin some day). I love his kit, he can potentially duel with anyone,


So I've got around 40+ champions, 30+ of them actually being Mastered level 5 which is insane, Ekko would be my champion I'd go for if I was stuck to play only one.

Which would you only play?

replies.body: I wouldn't take that deal at all, playing only one champion for the rest of my league life would kill my enjoyment of this game after a while, plus there's always the chance it gets banned, then what do I do?
This.  You could support/fill soraka, but once every 100 or 200 games, you will wind up as the jungler.
If I could only play one champ, I would've been FORCED to quit this game long ago.  That champ got removed from League all the way back in Patch 4.13 and still hasn't been re-added since.
{{champion:77}}

Azir or Zed, I love them both

but probably Azir

I also really like Aurelion Sol but only played him mid (did ok) and jungle (failed there) but am thinking of giving Sol support a try.
Kog'Maw. I just love how adorable he is, and the games where ur team protects you so hard and you penta is such an amazing experience(unlike vayne who can do it herself)
{{champion:268}}  I'm not good with him nor do I play him but if I did for a long long time I think the payoff would be quite large.
Well if you had asked me a few days ago, probably {{champion:112}}, but I guess I'll have to find a new one now.
Malzahar or Morgana.

And I already do it.

Each has so many buildpaths that I would never get bored, so any of them would work.

Probably Old Karma or {{champion:127}}. 

For some reason I tend to like short ranged mages.
Although I'm trash with him I would probably have to say {{champion:64}}  Because I can play 4 roles with him and do them all well as long as I get good with him

I think I agree here.  I mean Ekko is fine, but {{champion:64}} is better even though Ekko has a higher win rate.  Ekko's kit is diverse and complicated, but Lee Sin is simple, yet diverse.  Overall, I give the higher fun factor to Lee Sin despite his poor win rate.

{{champion:79}} has become a fast favorite of mine over the past week or so. He's incredibly versatile, works wonderfully in top lane, and can really impact a game through jungle. Mage Gragas mid is questionable, but I can work with it if I have to.

{{champion:113}} would be an easy alternate. I'm not sure about her lane viability, but she's very strong and has potential for significant damage if the enemy tries to fight through her W. 

{{champion:106}} is another excellent pick and would likely be my ultimate choice. Super strong top lane, good jungle clears, and potentially strong support against melee range opponent supports.

Gnar...fairly versatile, can go damage or tank, can have an emphasis on effectiveness as mini Gnar (Rageblade hurricane) or effectiveness as mega Gnar (tank for days)...can do some fun off meta builds utilizing the %health magic damage in mini gnar not to mention you can't help but have fun playing as Gnar

A close second would be Kennen tho, similar reasons as Gnar for versatility and fun factor.

What if you can't think of only one?

I mean since I rarely top, there's only one champ I'd pick for that role, but considering how the game forces you to choose two roles, the champ I'd pick for top is someone I wouldn't support or ADC on.  There's 2 champs I'd pick for support and then another 2 for jungle but I can't narrow those down to one.

Junglers are particularly screwed by this question because depending on where they pick and what their team needs are, it's unlikely there's just a single champ they can use.  If a support player mains annie or janna, that's not a problem.  But a jungler needs access to CC, AP, AD, tank, initiation, and carry potential all based on what his teammates are doing.
I already do that. Check my name.
I'd go for Ahri, my first love in the game and the only one I terribly miss when can't play for a while.  She's even very versatile so the gameplay can vary a lot.
